intro: Leucosyke weddellii, commonly known as the Weddell's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its erect, branching stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Leucosyke weddellii is known for its milky sap, which is a common feature among plants in the Apocynaceae family.
